Description: This exhibition presents a dialogue between the works of Matthew Wong and Vincent van Gogh, exploring their shared themes and artistic expressions.

exhibitionname: Ultra-Violet: New Light on Van Gogh’s Irises1
Description: This exhibition delves into the scientific analysis of Van Gogh's 'Irises,' revealing new insights into the artist's techniques and the painting's vibrant colors.
This exhibition explores the influence of color in Van Gogh's work, focusing on his use of yellow and its symbolic significance.

exhibitionname: How Van Gogh Came to Groningen
Description: This exhibition examines the journey of Van Gogh's works to Groningen, highlighting the city's role in preserving and showcasing his art.

exhibitionname: Van Gogh and the Modern Legacy
Description: Examines Van Gogh’s legacy and the way his art influenced the modern world and subsequent art movements.
A focused look at Van Gogh's landscapes, from his time in the Netherlands to his years in the south of France, showcasing works like 'The Red Vineyard' and 'The Road Menders.'
Explores Van Gogh's connections with the Impressionist movement and his collaborations with key artists of the time like Claude Monet.
An in-depth exploration of one of Van Gogh’s most iconic paintings, 'Starry Night,' and the emotional and symbolic meaning behind it.
This exhibition highlights the teachers and mentors who influenced Van Gogh’s artistic development, such as Cormon and Gauguin.
An exploration of Van Gogh's personal letters and the deep connection he had with his brother Theo, revealing the emotional depth behind his paintings.
